TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AppWidgetHostView extends Android.Widget.FrameLayout

Docs.summary: Provides the glue to show AppWidget views.

remarks.para: Provides the glue to show AppWidget views. This class offers automatic animation between updates, and will try recycling old views for each incoming RemoteViews.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Graphics.Rect? GetDefaultPaddingForWidget (Android.Content.Context? context, Android.Content.ComponentName? component, Android.Graphics.Rect? padding);

.method public static hidebysig class Android.Graphics.Rect GetDefaultPaddingForWidget(class Android.Content.Context context, class Android.Content.ComponentName component, class Android.Graphics.Rect padding) cil managed
static member GetDefaultPaddingForWidget : Android.Content.Context * Android.Content.ComponentName * Android.Graphics.Rect -> Android.Graphics.Rect

Docs.param: the current context
the component name of the widget
Rect in which to place the output, if null, a new Rect will be allocated and returned
Docs.summary: As of ICE_CREAM_SANDWICH we are automatically adding padding to widgets targeting ICE_CREAM_SANDWICH and higher.
Docs.returns: default padding for this widget, in pixels

remarks.para: As of ICE_CREAM_SANDWICH we are automatically adding padding to widgets targeting ICE_CREAM_SANDWICH and higher. The new widget design guidelines strongly recommend that widget developers do not add extra padding to their widgets. This will help achieve consistency among widgets.

Note: this method is only needed by developers of AppWidgetHosts. The method is provided in order for the AppWidgetHost to account for the automatic padding when computing the number of cells to allocate to a particular widget.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Reset the dynamically overloaded resources, reverting to the default values for all the colors.

remarks.para: Reset the dynamically overloaded resources, reverting to the default values for all the colors.
If colors were defined before, calling this method will trigger a full re-inflation of the App Widget.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

To be added.
Docs.summary: Set the AppWidget that will be displayed by this view.

remarks.para: Set the AppWidget that will be displayed by this view. This method also adds default padding to widgets, as described in #getDefaultPaddingForWidget(Context, ComponentName, Rect) and can be overridden in order to add custom padding.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetColorResources(class Android.Util.SparseIntArray colorMapping) cil managed
abstract member SetColorResources : Android.Util.SparseIntArray -> unit override this.SetColorResources : Android.Util.SparseIntArray -> unit

Docs.param: To be added.
Docs.summary: Set the dynamically overloaded color resources.

remarks.para:
Set the dynamically overloaded color resources.
colorMapping maps a predefined set of color resources to their ARGB representation. Any entry not in the predefined set of colors will be ignored.
Calling this method will trigger a full re-inflation of the App Widget.
The color resources that can be overloaded are the ones whose name is prefixed with system_neutral or system_accent, for example android.R.color#system_neutral1_500.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetExecutor(class Java.Util.Concurrent.IExecutor executor) cil managed
abstract member SetExecutor : Java.Util.Concurrent.IExecutor -> unit override this.SetExecutor : Java.Util.Concurrent.IExecutor -> unit

Docs.param: the executor to use or null.
Docs.summary: Sets an executor which can be used for asynchronously inflating.

remarks.para: Sets an executor which can be used for asynchronously inflating. CPU intensive tasks like view inflation or loading images will be performed on the executor. The updates will still be applied on the UI thread.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void UpdateAppWidgetSize (Android.OS.Bundle newOptions, System.Collections.Generic.IList<Android.Util.SizeF> sizes);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UpdateAppWidgetSize(class Android.OS.Bundle newOptions, class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Android.Util.SizeF> sizes) cil managed

abstract member UpdateAppWidgetSize : Android.OS.Bundle * System.Collections.Generic.IList<Android.Util.SizeF> -> unit override this.UpdateAppWidgetSize : Android.OS.Bundle * System.Collections.Generic.IList<Android.Util.SizeF> -> unit

Docs.param: The bundle of options, in addition to the size information.

Sizes, in dips, the widget may be displayed at without calling the provider again. Typically, this will be size of the widget in landscape and portrait. On some foldables, this might include the size on the outer and inner screens.
Docs.summary: Provide guidance about the size of this widget to the AppWidgetManager.

remarks.para: Provide guidance about the size of this widget to the AppWidgetManager. The sizes should correspond to the full area the AppWidgetHostView is given. Padding added by the framework will be accounted for automatically.
This method will update the option bundle with the list of sizes and the min/max bounds for width and height.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void UpdateAppWidgetSize (Android.OS.Bundle? newOptions, int minWidth, int minHeight, int maxWidth, int maxHeight);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UpdateAppWidgetSize(class Android.OS.Bundle newOptions, int32 minWidth, int32 minHeight, int32 maxWidth, int32 maxHeight) cil managed
abstract member UpdateAppWidgetSize : Android.OS.Bundle * int * int * int * int -> unit override this.UpdateAppWidgetSize : Android.OS.Bundle * int * int * int * int -> unit

Docs.param: The bundle of options, in addition to the size information, can be null.
The minimum width in dips that the widget will be displayed at.
The maximum height in dips that the widget will be displayed at.
The maximum width in dips that the widget will be displayed at.
The maximum height in dips that the widget will be displayed at.
Docs.summary: Provide guidance about the size of this widget to the AppWidgetManager.

remarks.para: Provide guidance about the size of this widget to the AppWidgetManager. The widths and heights should correspond to the full area the AppWidgetHostView is given. Padding added by the framework will be accounted for automatically. This information gets embedded into the AppWidget options and causes a callback to the AppWidgetProvider. In addition, the list of sizes is explicitly set to an empty list.
This member is deprecated. use AppWidgetHostView#updateAppWidgetSize(Bundle, List) instead.

format.a: Java documentation for android.appwidget.AppWidgetHostView.updateAppWidgetSize(android.os.Bundle, int, int, int, int).
